intro: Myrrhis temula, commonly known as lesser cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, yellowish-white flowers in late spring. The plant is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
